member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.Barcode.RssExpandedStacked
member.summary: When you set the Barcode Style property to RssExpandedStacked, this property allows you to control, via the RowCount property, the number of stacks of segments in which to display the code. You can specify two to eleven rows. Displaying an RSS Expanded barcode in stacks may be more appropriate for certain packaging requirements, as it reduces the length of a barcode.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle
member.summary: Type of code, or symbology, the barcode control will use to generate the barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.None
member.summary: None.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39
member.summary: ANSI 3 of 9 (Code 39) uses upper case, numbers, - , * $ / + %.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Ansi39x
member.summary: ANSI Extended 3 of 9 (Extended Code 39) uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_2_of_5
member.summary: Code 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code25intlv
member.summary: Interleaved 2 of 5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code25mat
member.summary: Code25mat

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Matrix_2_of_5
member.summary: Matrix 2 of 5 is a higher density barcode consisting of 3 black bars and 2 white bars. Matrix_2_of_5 uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code39
member.summary: Code 39 uses numbers, % * $ /. , - +, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code39x
member.summary: Extended Code 39 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_A
member.summary: Code 128 A uses control characters, numbers, punctuation, and upper case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_B
member.summary: Code 128 B uses punctuation, numbers, upper case and lower case.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_128_C
member.summary: Code 128 C uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_128auto
member.summary: Code 128 Auto

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_93
member.summary: Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code93x
member.summary: Extended Code 93 uses the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.MSI
member.summary: MSI Code uses only numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.PostNet
member.summary: PostNet uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Codabar
member.summary: Codabar uses A B C D + - : , / and numbers.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.EAN_8
member.summary: EAN-8 uses only numbers (7 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.EAN_13
member.summary: EAN-13 uses only numbers (12 numbers and a check digit). If there are only 12 numbers in the string, it calculates a checksum and adds it to the thirteenth position. If there are 13, it validates the checksum and throws an error if it is incorrect.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.UPC_A
member.summary: UPC-A uses only numbers (11 numbers and a check digit).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E0
member.summary: UPC-E0 uses only numbers. Used for zero-compression UPC symbols. For the Caption property, you may enter either a six-digit UPC-E code or a complete 11-digit (includes code type, which must be 0 (zero)) UPC-A code. If an 11-digit code is entered, the Barcode control will convert it to a six-digit UPC-E code, if possible. If it is not possible to convert from the 11-digit code to the six-digit code, nothing is displayed.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.UPC_E1
member.summary: UPC-E1 uses only numbers. Used typically for shelf labeling in the retail environment. The length of the input string for U.P.C. E1 is six numeric characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RM4SCC
member.summary: Royal Mail RM4SCC uses only letters and numbers (with a check digit). This is the barcode used by the Royal Mail in the United Kingdom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.UCCEAN128
member.summary: UCC/EAN –128 uses the complete ASCII character Set. This is a special version of Code 128 used in HIBC applications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.QRCode
member.summary: QRCode is a 2D symbology that is capable of handling numeric, alphanumeric and byte data as well as Japanese kanji and kana characters. This symbology can encode up to 7,366 characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code49
member.summary: Code 49 is a 2D high-density stacked barcode. Encodes the complete ASCII character set.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.JapanesePostal
member.summary: This is the barcode used by the Japanese Postal system. Encodes alpha and numeric characters consisting of 18 digits including a 7-digit postal code number, optionally followed by block and house number information. The data to be encoded can include hyphens.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Pdf417
member.summary: Pdf417 is a popular high-density 2-dimensional symbology that encodes up to 1108 bytes of information. This barcode consists of a stacked set of smaller barcodes. Encodes the full ASCII character set. Capable of encoding as many as 2725 data characters.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.EAN128FNC1
member.summary: EAN-128 is an alphanumeric one-dimensional representation of Application Identifier data. It is not meant for point-of-sales use, but for marking containers in the shipping industry.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSS14
member.summary: RSS14 is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Truncated
member.summary: RSS14Truncated is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus Indicator digits for use on small items, not for point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSS14Stacked
member.summary: RSS14Stacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14Truncated, but stacked in two rows when RSS14Truncated is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSS14StackedOmnidirectional
member.summary: RSS14StackedOmnidirectional is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSS14, but stacked in two rows when RSS14 is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpanded
member.summary: RSSExpanded is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification plus AI element strings (expiration date, weight, etc.) for use with omnidirectional point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSSExpandedStacked
member.summary: RSSExpandedStacked is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is the same as RSSExpanded, but stacked in two rows when RSSExpanded is too wide.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.RSSLimited
member.summary: RSS Limited is a Reduced Space Symbology that encodes Composite Component (CC) extended EAN and UPC information in less space. This version is a 14-digit EAN.UCC item identification with indicator digits of 0 or 1 in a small symbol that is not scanned by point-of-sale scanners.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.DataMatrix
member.summary: Data Matrix is a high density, two-dimensional barcode with square modules arranged in a square or rectangular matrix pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.MicroPDF417
member.summary: MicroPDF417 is two-dimensional (2D), multi-row symbology, derived from PDF417. Micro-PDF417 is designed for applications that need to encode data in a two-dimensional (2D) symbol (up to 150 bytes, 250 alphanumeric characters, or 366 numeric digits) with the minimal symbol size.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.MicroQRCode
member.summary: Micro QR Code is a variant of QR Code, with reduced barcode size. It has only one position detection pattern.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.MaxiCode
member.summary: MaxiCode is special polar barcode.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.GS1QRCode
member.summary: GS1 QRCode

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.GS1DataMatrix
member.summary: GS1 Data Matrix

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Aztec
member.summary: Aztec Code

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMail
member.summary: Intelligent Mail, formerly known as the 4-State Customer Barcode, is a 65-bar code used for domestic mail in the U.S.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.ITF14
member.summary: Interleaved Two of Five. This code is used to mark cartons and palettes that are including goods with an EAN-13 code. One digit is added in front of the EAN-13 code to mark the packing variant.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Code_11
member.summary: Encodes the numbers 0 through 9, the hyphen (-), and start/stop characters. It is primarily used in labeling telecommunications equipment.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.SSCC_18
member.summary: SSCC_18 is an 18-digit Serial Shipping Container Code. It is used to identify individual shipping containers for tracking purposes.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Telepen
member.summary: Telepen has 2 different modes - alphanumeric-only and numeric-only. Both modes require a start character, a check digit, and a stop character. It is mainly used in manufacturing industries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Pharmacode
member.summary: Pharmacode represents only numeric data from 3 to 131070. It is a barcode standard used in the pharmaceutical industry for packaging. It is designed to be readable despite printing errors.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.PZN
member.summary: PZN Pharmaceutical Central/General Number uses the same encoding algorithm as Code 39 but can carry only digits – 0123456789. The number of digits supported for encoding are 6 or 7. The letters 'PZN' and checksum digit are automatically added. It is mainly used to identify medicine and health-care products in Germany and other German-speaking countries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode128
member.summary: HIBCCode128 barcode uses the Code128 symbology. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.HIBCCode39
member.summary: HIBCCode39 barcode uses the Code39 symbology, with Code39OptionalCheckDigit property set to True. It encodes 'Primary Data' and 'Secondary Data' using slash (/) as delimiter. It is used in the health care products industry for identification purpose.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.ISBN
member.summary: International Standard Book Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code and is used as a unique 9-digit commercial book identifier.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.ISSN
member.summary: International Standard Serial Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used to identify serial publications, publications that are issued in numerical order, such as the volumes of a magazine.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.ISMN
member.summary: Internationally Standard Music Number barcode is a special form of the EAN-13 code. It is used for marking printed musical publications.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.IATA_2_of_5
member.summary: IATA_2_of_5 is a variant of Code_2_of_5 and uses only numbers with a check digit.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.BC412
member.summary: Data BC412 uses 35 characters, 0 - 9 and A - Z. It is designed for semiconductor wafer identification.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.Plessey
member.summary: Plessey uses hexadecimal digits to encode. It is a one-dimensional barcode used mainly in libraries.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeStyle.IntelligentMailPackage
member.summary: IntelligentMailPackage is more efficient in terms of processing and tracking mails than Intelligent Mail barcode.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeDirection
member.summary: Specifies the print direction of the barcode symbol.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeDirection.LeftToRight
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed left to right (default).

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeDirection.RightToLeft
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed right to left.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeDirection.TopToBottom
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed top to bottom.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.BarCodeDirection.BottomToTop
member.summary: The barcode symbol is printed bottom to top.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.ColumnDirection
member.summary: Specifies the direction of columns in a multi-column report.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.ColumnDirection.DownAcross
member.summary: Prints a column of details down the first column before moving on to the next column to its right.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.ColumnDirection.AcrossDown
member.summary: Print a row of details across all the columns before beginning a second row below it, and so on.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.GroupKeepTogether
member.summary: GroupKeepTogether applies to a group and has similar to the KeepTogether meaning, but for the whole group. It indicates whether the rendering engine should try to render the whole group on a single page, the group header plus the first detail on a single page, or leave the group flow as it is. If GroupKeepTogether is set to FirstDetail - the group header and at least one detail in this group should be on the same page; if set to All - the whole group should be on a single page. The following rule applies: the rendering engine will try to render the group as specified, but if there is not enough space on the current page, the group is moved to the next page and it continues as long as it needs.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.GroupKeepTogether.None
member.summary: The rendering engine will leave the group flow as it is.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.GroupKeepTogether.FirstDetail
member.summary: The rendering engine should try to keep the group header and at least 1 detail on the same page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.GroupKeepTogether.All
member.summary: The rendering engine should try to keep the whole group on the same page.

member.name: T:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle
member.summary: Specifies whether a group header section will be repeated with subsequent detail pages.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle.None
member.summary: The group header will not be repeated when the associated detail sections print on a new page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle.OnPage
member.summary: Repeat the group header section with every new page.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle.OnColumn
member.summary: Repeat the group header section with every new column.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle.All
member.summary: Repeat the group header section on every page or column.

member.name: F:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SectionReportModel.RepeatStyle.OnPageIncludeNoDetail
member.summary: Repeat the group header section on every page that includes an associated detail section or a group footer section. This setting prevents orphaned group footer sections.

member.name: P:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.Data.Field.Formula
member.summary:
Field Value, used for unbound fields, this can be a formula or a static value Formaula can be combination of any number of other bound or unbound fields. eg. 1. Field3.Formula = field1 + field2; (where field1 = Field1.Name and field2 = Field2.Name) 2. field1.Formula = "\"Hello : \" + CustomerID"; 3. field1.Formula = "2 + 4 / 6"
Value of Field is based on FieldType which is used to evaluate as the type and the result is set to Field.Value Order of Evaluation: 1. Field.Formula, 2. If Field.Formula is null, Field.DefaultValue is used. 3. If Field.DefaultValue is null, Field.Value is used, which may or may not be null. Field.Value can also be set at run time.

member.name: M:GrapeCity.ActiveReports.SerializationManager.WriteObject(System.Xml.XmlDocument,System.Collections.IDictionary,System.Object)
member.summary: This method writes the given object out to the XML document.
member.param: The XML document.
The dictionary of components names.
The object to be written to the document.
member.remarks:
Objects have the following XML:
Here, Object is the element that defines a custom object. Type is required and specifies the data type of the object. Name is optional. If present, it names this object, adding it to the container if the object is an IComponent. Finally, the children attribute is optional. If present, this object can have nested objects, and those objects will be added to the given property name. The property must be a collection property that returns an object that implements IList.
Inside the object tag there can be zero or more of the following subtags:
InstanceDescriptor -- describes how to create an instance of the object. Property -- a property set on the object Event -- an event binding Binary -- binary data

member.name: T:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration
member.summary: CSSDeclaration represents the declaration block of a CSS rule. Provides a programmatic interface directly to the CSS declarations.
member.remarks: Use the publicly accessable m_pXxxx structs to retrieve known property values. Unknown properties and their text values are available in the publicly accessable m_unknownPropTable variable. Use AppendValue to append values to this CSSDeclaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.#ctor
member.summary: The default constructor for CSSDeclaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.Reset
member.summary: Resets all CSSValues contained in this declaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.AppendValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,DDCssLib.CSSValue)
member.summary: Adds the specified value for the specified property to this CSSDeclaration.
member.param: The property the value should be used for.
The value of the property.
member.remarks: This method will keep track of the order that the properties are added in so that when the CSS string is recreated, you have the capability to list the properties in the same order as they were originally specified in the declaration block.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.AppendUnknownValue(System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Used to append unknown properties to this declaration. The unknown name and value will be used only when rebuilding the CSS string again.
member.param: The unchanged name of the CSS property parsed.
The unchanged value for the CSS property.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.SetValueImportant(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty)
member.summary: Sets the value important.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty)
member.summary: Returns the value of the specified property as a CSSValue object.
member.param: The property to get the value of.
member.returns: The CSSValue object containing the specified property's value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValue(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,System.String@)
member.summary: Retrieves the value for the specified CSS property from this declaration instance and places the value into sValue.
member.param: The CSS property to retrieve the value for.
The string variable to set to the string representation of the specified property's value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetImportantValues(DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration@)
member.summary: Returns all of the property/values in this CSSDeclaration instance that were marked with the !important declaration.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValueIsImportant(DDCssLib.eCSSProperty,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the specified property stored in this CSSDeclaration instance was marked with the !important declaration.
member.param: The property to check for important.
The boolean variable who's value will be True if the specified property is marked as important, or false if the specified property is not marked as important.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetValueIsImportant(System.String,System.Boolean@)
member.summary: Determines if the specified property stored in this CSSDeclaration instance was marked with the !important declaration.
member.param: The string name of the property to check for important.
The boolean variable who's value will be True if the specified property is marked as important, or false if the specified property is not marked as important.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.Count
member.summary: Returns the number of declarations stored by this CSSDeclaration instance (that were added with AppendValue).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.GetProperty(System.Int32)
member.summary: Returns the eCSSProperty at the specified index in the property order array.
member.param: The index within the order array to retrieve the element at.
member.returns: The eCSSProperty value at the specified index within the order array.
member.remarks: The "order array" keeps track of what order the properties were added to the declaration in, so that when the CSS string is recreated the properties are in the original order.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.ToString
member.summary: Returns the propery/value pair(s) contained in this CSSDeclaration in standards based CSS declaration block syntax.
member.returns: The CSS text string. If there are not any properties stored by this CSSDeclaration, an empty string will be returned.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration.Clone(DDCssLib.CSSDeclaration@)
member.summary: Creates copy of this instance and places it in the specified variable.
member.param: The variable to contain a copy of the instance of CSSDeclaration the Clone method is called on.

member.name: T:DDCssLib.CSSValue
member.summary: Encapsulates a value for a CSSProperty.
member.remarks: When callign any of the Get...Value() properties the current unit type must be valid. Ensure the unit type is valid using CSSValue.Unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.#ctor(DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Constructs the class with the specified unit type.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.#ctor(System.Int32,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Constructs the class with the specified unit type, and integer value.
member.param: The integer value to construct the class with.
The unit type to construct the class with. Shold be Integer or Enumerated.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.#ctor(System.Single,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Constructs the class with the specified unit type, and value.
member.param: The value to construct the class with.
The unit type to construct the class with. Should be eCSSUnit.Percent.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.#ctor(System.String,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Constructs the class with the specified unit type, and string value.
member.param: The string value to construct the class with.
The unit type to construct the class with. Should be eCSSUnit.String, or eCSSUnit.Counters

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.#ctor(DDCssLib.eCSSUnit,System.Drawing.Color,System.String)
member.summary: Constructs the class with the specified color.
member.param: The Color value to construct the class with.
The type of color being stored.
The way that the color value should be outputed when outputed as a string.

member.name: P:DDCssLib.CSSValue.Unit
member.summary: Gets/sets the Unit value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsColorUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the unit type is current a valid color unit (eCSSUnit.Color_Hex or eCSSUnit.Color_Name or eCSSUnit.Color_RGBFunc or eCSSUnit.Color_System).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsLengthUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the unit type is currently a valid length unit (fixed or relative).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsFixedLengthUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the unit type is currently a valid fixed length unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsRelativeLengthUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the unit type is currently a valid relative length unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsAngularUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the unit type is currently a valid Angle unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsFrequencyUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the current unit type is a valid Frequency unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.IsTimeUnit
member.summary: Returns true if the current unit type is a valid time unit.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetIntValue
member.summary: Returns an integer value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetPercentValue
member.summary: Returns the current percent value as a float.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetFloatValue
member.summary: Returns a value as a float.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetStringValue
member.summary: Returns the current string value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetColorValue
member.summary: Returns the current color value as a Color object. If the current unit type is string it will be converted using ColorTranslator.FromHtml(). If the current value is a Color it is returned directly.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetLengthTwips(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a length value in twip units.
member.param: This value is necessary to convert a device independent length unit (mm, cm, inch, etc...) from the device dependent unit pixels. If the value was specified in a device independent unit, then this value will not be used.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetLengthPixels(System.Single)
member.summary: Returns a length value in pixel units.
member.param: The number of pixels per twip. This value will be used if a conversion from a device independent length unit (mm, cm, pica, etc...) is necessary. If the length value was originally specified as pixels, then this value will not be used.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetIntValue(System.Int32,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Specifies the value as an integer.
member.param: The integer value to store.
The CSS unit type the value is.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetPercentValue(System.Single)
member.summary: Specifies the value as a percent.
member.param: A percentage (0-100) value. According to CSS this value could range from negative to greater than 100.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.Reset
member.summary: Resets this current value. Sets all value members to their appropriate empty equivelent (numbers are set to 0), and sets the current Unit type to eCSSUnit.Null.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetFloatValue(System.Single,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Specifies this current value as a float.
member.param: The value to store.
The CSS unit type the value is in.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetStringValue(System.String,DDCssLib.eCSSUnit)
member.summary: Specifies this class's current value as a string.
member.param: The string value to store.
The CSS unit type of the value.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetColorValue(DDCssLib.eCSSUnit,System.Drawing.Color,System.String)
member.summary: Specifies this class's current value as a System.Drawing.Color object. Will set the Unit value to eCSSUnit.Color.
member.param: The actual color value in System.Drawing.Color.
The way that the color value should be outputed when the CSS string is rebuilt.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetAutoValue
member.summary: Specifies that this CSSValue's value is the CSS keyword 'auto'.
member.remarks: Used for margin-top, margin-right, margin-bottom, margin-left, margin, width, and height values.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetInheritValue
member.summary: Indicates that this value is not null, not none, but should be inherited from the parent object of the object who's style this value is applied to. In CSS this is the default value for many *child* elements's (but certainly not all) style properties who's style is not specified.
member.remarks: See CSS Level 1 Recomendation Section 1.3 Inheritance: http://www.w3.org/TR/REC-CSS1#inheritance An important statement in this section is the following: "Some style properties are not inherited from the parent element to the child element. Most often it is intuitive why this is not the case. E.g., the 'background' property does not inherit, but the parent element's background will shine through by default."

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetNoneValue
member.summary: Sets this class's value to the special CSS value 'none' (e.g. border properties, background-image, display, etc...).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.SetNormalValue
member.summary: Sets this class'es value to the special CSS value 'normal'. (e.g. font-style, font-variant, font-weight, word-spacing, letter-spacing, line-height).

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.ToDebugString
member.summary: Writes out the current unit type and value in a string formatted appropriately for debugging purposes.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.ToString
member.summary: Writes out this class's current value in string form.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.CopyFrom(DDCssLib.CSSValue)
member.summary: Performs a "deep copy" (memebers and child memebers) the specified CSSValue to this CSSValue instance.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.Equals(System.Object)
member.summary: Override of System.Object.Equals(). Checks for value equality of the Unit and actual Value contained in this object.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.op_Equality(DDCssLib.CSSValue,DDCssLib.CSSValue)
member.summary: After checking arguments for null, uses valA.Equals(valB). If either argument is null, the return will be false.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.op_Inequality(DDCssLib.CSSValue,DDCssLib.CSSValue)
member.summary: After checking both arguments for null, uses !valA.Equals(valB). If either argument is null, true will be returned.

member.name: M:DDCssLib.CSSValue.GetHashCode
member.summary: Provides a hashcode by XORing the Unit.GetHashCode() and {value}.GetHashCode().

member.name: T:DDCssLib.eCSSUnit
member.summary: The available types of CSSUnits.

members.member: (n/a) null unit, value is not specified
(n/a) value is normal (algorithmic, different than auto)

(int) simple value //FYI: Any new int values should be greater than Integer, and less than Enumerated, as unit checks do a comparison like this: if ( (eCSSUnit_Integer <= m_unit) && (m_unit <= eCSSUnit.Enumerated) ) then value is int
(color + string) an RGBA value, was specified as "#xxxxxx", (color) contains the actual color, (string) contains how it was originally specified.
(color + string) an RGBA value, was specified as "RGB(iR,iG,iB)" (color) contains the actual color, (string) contains how it was originally specified.
(color + string) Color specified as a CSS color name. (string) contains the original name, (color) contains the color
(color + string) Color specified as a CSS color name. (string) contains the original system color keyword (e.g. Activeborder, Buttontext, Highlight etc...), (color) contains the color
(float) value is numeric (usually multiplier, different behavior that percent)
(float) distance from top of lower case x to baseline
(float) distance from top of uppercase case H to baseline
(float) number of characters, used for width with monospace font

member.name: P:DDCssLib.StyleSheetRule.FontFamily
member.summary: Gets/sets the FontFamily value. If this StyleSheetRule's declaration does not contain the value, or the value is indicated as null, it will be returned from it's parent. When the property is set the value will only be set to this StyleSheetRule's declaration instance (not the parent's).
member.remarks: Multiple families seperated by commas may be returned.

member.name: P:DDCssLib.StyleSheetRule.DdCharset
member.summary: Implementation of IStyleSheetRule.DdCharset. DdCharset is the charset/script for the font.

member.name: P:DDCssLib.StyleSheetRule.InheritsFontSize
member.summary: Gets a value indicating whether current stylesheet rule inherits font size value.

members.member:
Returns font size in points.
Sometimes font-size is specified (in the CSS style string) in a value that cannot be converted to points. For example a size relative to the parent, and there is no parent. Or Font XHeight (the height of the letter x) where this not enough data to perform a conversion. // the reason other props don't through exceptions is because we return Inherit in the event of an error on the get. This can't be done with FontSize because it's not an enum.
